I didn't mean for you to download anything. ffmpeg is installed by running 'sudo apt-get install ffmpeg'
it's extremely easy, once you understand how. What's more, it doesn't break like Windows does - no DLL hell in Linux

you installed ffmpeg, and it worked?
then you should be able to use the command from the Gentoo advice page, 'ffmpeg -i Video.avi -f psp -r 29 -b 768 -ar 24000 -ab 64 -s 320x240 M4V00001.MP4'
be sure to replace the real name of the video file you are converting
then you should be able to use the command from the Gentoo advice page, 'ffmpeg -i Video.avi -f psp -r 29 -b 768 -ar 24000 -ab 64 -s 320x240 M4V00001.MP4'
